poem:
Title: "Fuel in the Fire, the Game of Words"

In the heart of London
a fume rises, acrid,
from incendiary words spat.

Islamist control cried,
a gleam of bigotry ignited,
a sooty suspicion cast.

The mayor, the city,
each echo warns against
the pyre of hatred built.

Fair game is no sport,
but a tireless chasing,
where fear makes the rules.

Alas, the smoke obscures,
while truth ever blooms, unnoticed,
in the garden of diversity.
